intro: Acer formosum, commonly known as the Taiwan maple, is a deciduous tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds known as samaras. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soil in temperate climates. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
